This is how they will launch their effort to ultimately getting to impeaching the president. That is how desperate they are. But it starts tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: While the president is here in Vietnam --

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- you know, trying to negotiate the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula. It's really outrageous. Congressman Nunes, one question. So many people kept asking me. We have been able to slowly unravel this onion, take a layer off the day as it relates to the deep state. We now know James Baker, the general counselor, the top lawyer of the FBI and Comey thought that Hillary should be indicted. We know obstruction would be a slam-dunk case. We're waiting on FISA operation, 302s, interviews, Gang of Eight information. When are we going to get all of that?

utterances.speaker: NUNES
utterances.utterance: So here is what we're doing. We're going to be doing talking about the last phase of our investigation and laying out everything else that we have left to do. We're going to be working with Jim Jordan and Doug Collins. So, Republicans are going to have the task force that we set up in the last Congress continuing. It's going to take declassification by the president. I think it's going to take full transparency. We have all of this talk whether or not the Mueller report is going to be transparent and going to be released. I have no problem with that as long as it's not the Mueller report. It's all the interviews, any informants that they had --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Both of you have seen this?

utterances.speaker: NUNES
utterances.utterance: We want to know all of that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Both of you know that Bruce Ohr in August warned everybody, Hillary bought the dossier. It was not verified and corroborated and that Christopher Steele hated President Trump. They signed four times.

utterances.speaker: NUNES
utterances.utterance: Just remember, Sean -- I just want you to remember, Comey and others have said that it wasn't the dossier. The dossier only played a small part of that FISA application.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's not what Andrew McCabe said. Without a dossier, no FISA.

utterances.speaker: NUNES
utterances.utterance: But remember what I've said, it's bad enough that they've used the dossier. The rest of the craft that they used is even worse. And that's what we want declassified.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Jim Jordan, last word.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Bruce Ohr also talked to Andrew Weissmann before he got on the special counsel's team about the bias Christopher Steele had against President Trump when they launched this whole darn thing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Real quick question, is the Mueller report -- you have seen everything both of you. You would expect it will be anticlimactic and there's no collusion? Do you agree with that assessment, Devin Nunes?

utterances.speaker: NUNES
utterances.utterance: Well, I think what you have to see is what the Mueller supporters are continuing at this. So, they're telegraphing already right now that there is nothing that is going to be in there. Look, we know nothing is going to be in there because there was no evidence of collusion and conspiracy. It was ridiculous from the beginning. The only thing they ever had was the information that the Clinton campaign --

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Sean, all the way up until the day James Comey is fired, he told us there was still no evidence of any collusion whatsoever. We know there's not going to be any collusion in this final report.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Great, but there was collusion. Hillary bought and paid for Russian lies, and then it was used to stop -- well, first, influence an election in her favor and then later to bludgeon a duly elected president and unseat him -- the biggest abuse of power scandal ever. Thank you both. All right. The Democrats is a party of late-term abortion, today, they blocked a bill on infanticide. Newt Gingrich will join us. And later, Jorge Ramos detained in Venezuela. Thankfully, he's safe. He'll tell his story exclusively, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. So, the Democrats' far left, extreme, radical agenda now on abortion hitting new levels of radicalism. Quick reminder, by the way, New York passed a law allowing abortion up to the mother's due date. And a barbaric proposal, remember in Virginia nearly succeeded, would have allowed an abortion while a woman begins labor. And remember, disgraced Virginia Democratic governor, Ralph Northam, took it even a step further when describing the process, for letting a baby -- well, first, the baby is going to be born, we'll make the baby comfortable. And then the mother will decide whether or not to resuscitate it or a given medical aid. Now, Senate Democrats, they have blocked the GOP back born alive bill. That would provide medical care to infants who survive failed abortions. Let's be clear here, that is infanticide, plain and simple. And refusing to care for a child born alive, living independently has the support of all 2020 Democratic Senate hopefuls? But they couldn't be more out of touch with the American people. Now, President Trump responded. He tweeted out, quote, Senate Democrats just voted against legislation to prevent the killing of newborn infant children. Democratic position on abortion is so extreme, they don't mind literally executing babies after birth.

utterances.speaker: And added, quote
utterances.utterance: This will be remembered as one of the most shocking votes in the history of Congress. And it looks like, well, Illinois maybe next. A pro-life group is warning a new proposal will make the state the, quote, abortion capital of America. This and more on Democratic extremism, former speaker of the house and new host of "Newt's World" podcast. Look at that. It's amazing. We're very happy to have back, Fox News contributor Newt Gingrich. I don't even know what to say here. You know, I don't think people could do this to a puppy or a kitten. What they are describing, but they were voting for.

utterances.speaker: NEWT GINGRICH, FORMER SPEAKER OF HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
utterances.utterance: Well, I think most liberal Democrats would be more upset if you did it to a puppy or a kitten than if you do it to a baby. It's a little hard to understand what has happened psychologically to the Democratic Party that you could add a large group of people. I think all three of the Democratic senators vote in effect to allow the killing of babies who are already born. The position taken, as you point out, by the governor of Virginia, is that it's really OK because we'll keep the baby comfortable while we decide whether or not to kill it. I mean, this is pure infanticide in a way which is unthinkable in most of the world. And if this was a foreign country and we were describing a foreign country which allowed babies to be killed after they were born, even most liberals would be shocked and horrified. But what you are seeing right now -- and I don't know whether it is just a natural maturation of the left over the last 40 years or impartially reaction to Trump, on almost on every front, they now feel compelled to rush to the most extreme positions, even if they are crazy. And someone said the other day, they have now become literally the party of death and taxes. And I think there is a lot to that. And I can't understand on a practical level what they think they are doing. But also, I cannot understand morally. You know, one or two people, yes, but to have every Democratic presidential candidate vote that it is OK to kill babies after they are born puts them in such a small minority, I don't quite see how they think they're going to create a winning campaign.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Speaker add to that, we're going to get rid of airplanes, cows, we're going to rebuild every home, everything's free - not that the government runs a lot well college and education and jobs and security and vacations and healthy food and health care, but you can't have your own. What has happened here, because the fact that they're so open about these beliefs, to me is political suicide?

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Well, I think what you've had happen is that in a small number of Congressional districts, mostly in the inner-city, a number of people won very tiny margins. If you look at Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, I think that her total share of the vote was 19%, but there was such a small turnout that 19% could elect her. The various cartoons that are now on the internet describing her in ways they're just funny, fit what's happening. This is a person who doesn't know anything, doesn't seem to want to learn anything. But, frankly, it's not just because she's young, interesting woman, look at Bernie Sanders. Here's a guy who's been around forever. He can't even bring himself to say that Maduro in Venezuela is a dictator. Now you look at the entire lifetime of apologizing for the Soviet Union, apologizing for Fidel Castro, Bernie Sanders has never met a Left-winger he didn't like. And so you have this whole thing coming together, partially I think a reaction to Hillary Clinton that she was so unacceptable to most liberals that they've gone further to the Left in response, partially in reacting to Donald Trump. Who, again, is from the standpoint of a Left- winger is so unacceptable. But I'm - I've been around long enough, what I'm reminded of is George McGovern in 1972 and the collapse of the Democratic Party as people began to realize when you go around the country, I don't think there's a single state, not one, in which they can get a majority in favor of killing babies after they're born.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Mr. Speaker, I'm here in Vietnam. I'm in Hanoi. It takes 26 hours to get here. I'm just saying and I'm glad to be here. The President tomorrow will be trying to negotiate - the President ready gotten hostages back, remains back. He has - no more rockets are being fired, I think that's a good thing for the world. But at the same time the Democrats are holding three days of hearings tomorrow - public, while the president's in the middle of negotiations, putting Michael Cohen out there. Whatever happened to politics ends at the water's edge.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Look, I think you just have to assume that the Democratic Party has lost any sense of patriotism, any sense of balance, any sense of propriety. And you would think when you when you deal with something like, the Korean War, the nuclear weapons in North Korea, the potential to maybe get a breakthrough. It might work, it may not work. But, boy, it sure a courageous step. You would think that most of the Democrats would have said, we can do this next week when he comes back home. But it tells you that the bitterness that - the hatred, frankly, is so deep that they can't see beyond their own fratricidal warfare. Very dangerous for the country, I think.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I agree with you. All right, Mr. Speaker, we're going to watch a little scary moment for the country and we appreciate you being with us. All right, when we come back, not only the Democrats do a Michael Cohen for three days in a row, undermining the President's Summit, but they're also spending all week trying to block President's border emergency declaration. They won't win, Geraldo, Dan Bongino, also Jorge Ramos detained after asking the Venezuelan dictator some tough questions, thankful he's been released. He'll join us, share his story what went down, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Last week a Massachusetts woman allegedly assaulted a young man in a restaurant. Why? Wearing a Make America Great Again hat. Oh, the great trigger of our day. Turns out, we are now learning the suspect is an illegal immigrant from Brazil now in ICE custody. Meanwhile, the House just passed a resolution to nullify the President's national emergency declaration. Now goes to the Senate, doesn't look like they will be able to overcome a Presidential Veto. Joining us now with reaction Fox News Correspondent-at-Large Geraldo Rivera and right here on set in Hanoi, Vietnam, Fox News Contributor Dan Bongino. We'll go to you first. I'm looking at this another thing they're working on this week. Let's try - if 90% of heroin coming into the country and fentanyl and 4,000 homicides and 10,000 sexual assaults and 130,000 sexual assaults and a 100,000 violent assaults is not an emergency?

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, just be candid, you have to be an imbecile to believe there's not an emergency on our Southern border. I mean, either you're not processing right or you're such a political animal that the fact that there is-- You know what's weird about this, Sean, is, when it when it came to the obvious emergency situation where those children tragically died, the Democrats were all over the fact that it was an emergency. But now that - and that was an unquestioned human tragedy. Now that that's passed and it's not to be used for political purposes anymore, now it's not an emergency. And by the way Trump's got them all smoked on this anyway, between the 1.3 billion allocated the MILCON budget and the Treasury funds he's got. He's already got the 5 billion. They play all they want with all this national emergency stuff.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And everything else they actually funded.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. And everything else - so, he's already got the 5 billion he needs, while they play around.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And Geraldo, the President says, keep building the wall, finish the wall. They've started, they're repairing. Its building, it's being built. Even you recognize that this is--

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: Even me--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --a very important issue.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Even me, you got left behind, when you take Bongino to Vietnam, I get left behind - even me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, we invited you, if I recall.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, sure. You invited me to the Vietnam restaurant across the street maybe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The President's wall is going to build, Sean. There's no way they can stop it. Put aside the merits of the issue, the President has the power. The Congress can pass this resolution. There is no way they're going to get two-thirds of both the House and the Senate to override a Presidential Veto, unless one of the lawsuits succeeds, and I don't believe that's going to happen either. The wall will be built.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ultimately it's going to happen. But really this is what they do and the President's here in Vietnam, Geraldo. That coupled with their radical--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Awful.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --New Deal proposals, late-term abortion. Don't you think they're kind of marginalizing themselves?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm sick in my stomach that they are scheduling Michael Cohen's testimony for tomorrow. I mean the fact that they are putting this tabloid person, you feel much more sympathetic toward him than I do. This is a lawyer who has betrayed his client and everything about him just reeks of kind of sleaziness--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, where is attorney/client - Geraldo? Where is it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The President is on - he stands on the cusp of a potential historic breakthrough, reducing the threat of nuclear war on earth, threatening tens of millions of people, MSNBC and CNN barely mentioned Korea, barely mentioned this summit, barely mention the stakes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Disgraceful. All right, let me--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --just for Michael Cohen, it's awful.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dan.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: It really makes you wonder right now this Cohen thing. What side the Democrats are on? And it really pains me to say that being with - at this historic summit right now. I mean Geraldo is actually right. We have the potential for a historic nuclear breakthrough with a country who just, what a year ago, was threatening to take out portions of Hawaii and Guam. And we're doing taxicab confessions on Capitol Hill with Michael Cohen, absolutely disgraceful. What side--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right. This is by - in the end the American people going to--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Sean, the optics here are awful. The foil of--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Does that?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course, they're talking taxicab confessions. We're denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, Geraldo, you're invited on every trip moving forward if you didn't get the invitation. All right, up next, Jorge Ramos detained by Venezuela's brutal dictator who didn't like his question. He's going to share that story coming up next. And your e-mail on my scooter right, oh boy, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. As we continue from Hanoi in Vietnam, well yesterday journalist Jorge Ramos and Univision staffers, they were detained at the presidential palace in Venezuela after an interview with Venezuelan dictator Nicolas Maduro. Now apparently Maduro didn't like the questions that were asked and ended the interview when Jorge Ramos showed him this video of hungry Venezuelans eating out of a garbage truck. After being held for three hours, the group was thankfully released. Univision News Anchor Jorge Ramos joins us now. First of all, I'm glad you're out. I was nervous about what was happening

utterances.speaker: JORGE RAMOS, UNIVISION NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: I know, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --and we disagree. But I don't disagree on protecting all Americans, whoever they are, wherever they are, and I said it last night and I mean it. I'm saying it to you personally.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: And I want to thank you personally. Sean, I know that we have many differences on immigration and put those differences aside. Because when I needed that support the most, I heard that you were talking about us in Venezuela, and that was incredibly important. So from the bottom of my heart thank you so much, Sean, thanks so much to Fox News. Because - and on those moments, when you are detained in a dictatorship, when there's no one to help you and you see a tweet or you see a report from Fox News or from an American media, that you're not alone, and we felt that we were not alone. So muchas gracias.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. Listen, we - I'm not great with my - I started in school three years, but it's not great Jorge. Tell everybody what happened, because they took your tapes. By the way, those are real videos of real Venezuelans. It should be one of the richest countries in the entire world that are eating out of garbage trucks, and that is widespread and I applaud you for calling attention to the suffering of human beings. This isn't politics to me.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: It is terrible what's happening right now in Venezuela. There's a humanitarian crisis. The minimum wage, Sean, is $5. Not $5 an hour or $5 a day. $5 a month, that's minimum wage. So that's why there is so much hunger. We - the interview with Nicolas Maduro, it lasted about 17 minutes. I think was a strong interview. It was all right. But then I show him the kids that you just showed on a garbage truck. And he just couldn't stand it. He stood up he tried to cover the image, so the cameras wouldn't be able to see it. And then I told him, Mr. Maduro - I didn't call him President. I called him Mr. Maduro. What are you doing? Why don't you answer the questions? What you are doing is what dictators do. And then and then he left. One of his ministers came back. They confiscated four cameras, Sean. They took our tape cards where we actually store the interviews and then they detain us for two hours. They took away our cell phones. And at this point - at this point we don't have the cameras, we don't have the interview. And they gave my cell back, although all the cellphones from my colleagues, they're still in Venezuela.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We're having a debate in this country and you - everyone knows we have a well-documented disagreement on immigration and border security and American sovereignty in American law, we'll put that aside. But I look at a country like Venezuela, all the grandiose promises, "We'll take care of everything, we'll do everything, government, socialism". It fails and I'm just curious, as you see this these arguments being made in our country about 70 percent tax rates, marginal rates, guaranteed education, health care, jobs, security, everything - college. I'm wondering if you see the dangers as I do, how socialism does almost universally lead to poverty and false promises.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: What I saw in Venezuela is that the 20-year-old revolution is started with Hugo Chavez in 1999 has failed completely. You have more than 3 million Venezuelans live in the country. Inflation is 1 million percent. If they pay one bolivar today, it would be a million bolivars in a year from now. And people are dying. I went to a hospital, Hospital Vargas. And then one woman she had lost a family member and you know why, they didn't have $30 to pay for antibiotics. So the experiment in Venezuela has failed completely. And you know something? I really appreciate the freedom and the liberties that we have here in the United States. You know we know that that I have my differences with President Trump, but this is the difference. You can criticize the President of the United States and I can go home and nothing happens to me, Sean. But if I criticize the dictator of Venezuela, they confiscate my cameras, they take my interviews --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Terrible.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: They detain me and then they expel me from the country. Those are two big, big differences.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Last thing, I'll add, this is a political point that I'll make. Obama, eight years, 13 million more Americans on food stamps, 8 million more poverty. Obamacare millions lost their doctors, their plans they got one option and everybody paid more. Those are the false promises I think of socialism and the danger. And under Donald Trump, look at this, record low unemployment for African- Americans, Hispanic-Americans, Asian-Americans, women in the workplace. And I come from very blue-collar roots. I want the forgotten men and women in this country, and frankly the world, to have the blessings of freedom that we take for granted, as I can see here in Vietnam a lot of poverty.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: And I understand your political point, and if you allow me, in this case especially for this interview, Sean--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You got about 25 seconds.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: I will concentrate on what I saw in Venezuela. And healthcare Venezuela - the socialist heath care in Venezuela is terrible. I mean, I saw this woman who just didn't have enough money for antibiotics. I saw a family whose 15-year-old Christian is dying because they couldn't do blood tests in the hospital. So they took his blood in a tube and they put it in a glass with ice and they had to take it to another place. And the boy, most likely, will die very soon, simply because they don't have enough medicines. So that's what happening with a revolution - the Venezuelan revolution right now with Nicolas Maduro.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We may disagree on immigration very strongly, but we agree on humanitarian issues and--

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: We do.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --and the - and poverty and what's happened there. I'm glad you're out. Next time we're going to have another fight. So - but we like you home.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: Well, we'll have a fight. And - first - and let me thank the U.S. Department, the State Department and in the American Embassy in Caracas, thanks to them, I'm here today in Miami.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I think you should just say I love Donald Trump and it all be over, it's all good. Welcome home.

utterances.speaker: RAMOS
utterances.utterance: Not today. Not today, Sean. Thank you so much. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I understand. All right, we're glad you're out. Thank you. Coming up next, big announcement, you don't want to miss. And yes a lot of you had e-mail about my scooter trip, some of it's hilarious, next straight ahead from Vietnam.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Last night we aired footage from my now, I guess, infamous - shows I have a sense of humor, scooter right in Hanoi. Well, some of you had some very strong opinions about that. One viewer wrote, "Love you Sean. Please be careful with all the traffic. Be safe. Thanks for supporting a President. God bless you and President Trump". Thank you very much. Dianne remarked, you are - who picked this. I'm not saying this, I'm like - anyway. "Love the glasses. You should wear your hair like that on the show. Edward asked, "Where's your helmet HANNITY?" Sorry no helmets. And before we go, by the way, we do have a big announcement in that UC Berkeley campus assault case. The University of California has concluded its investigation into the February 19th assault on conservative activist Hayden Williams that the media ignored and is seeking a felony warrant for the identified suspect. If a warrant is issued, police will pursue his arrest. We're going to follow this closely, and of course bring you every update. Also finally, we do have a big announcement, and make sure to tune in to this program Thursday night one-on-one exclusive interview with President Trump right after his second historic summit with North Korea's Kim Jong- un. It's an exclusive interview. You'll only see here on HANNITY, and we look forward to that. We also - you would think that the rest of the country would forget about red and blue and forget about conservative, liberal, and Republican, Democrat. Maybe we should really hope for the safety and security of our children and the world that the President succeeds. Not hate him like they do over everything - even if he cured cancer. All right. Thank you for being with us. We'll never be the hate-Trump Media. Let not your heart be troubled. Laura Ingraham is next. Laura? Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC.
